question.title: Information
question.text:
I understand that this Course is about moving into a new life after leaving an abusive relationship and that some content could be triggering.
If I feel uncomfortable at any time, then I will remove my headset and ask for support.
If you feel that you are being disturbed by any material, then please press and hold the trigger button on your hand controller and this will take you to the next screen.

question.title: Data Protection
question.text:
I understand that some of my responses will be stored so MMP can see if the course has helped Survivors of Domestic Abuse.
This data will be held strictly in line with GDPR principles.

question.title: Health and Safety
question.text: I confirm that I have understood read and signed the Health and Safety consent form given to me by my facilitator

question.title: Health and Safety 2
question.text: I agree that I am taking part in the course at my own risk but that I understand that I can exit the VR headset at any point.

question.title: Mega feelings Wall
question.text: Please select four words that sum up how you are currently feeling about your situation.

question.text: To which gender identity do you most identify?

question.text: Do you have children under the age of 18?

question.title: How long ago did you leave the abusive relationship?
question.text: How long ago did you leave the abusive relationship?

On a scale of 1-5 how well do you feel you have recovered from what happened to you?
1 being I am not coping at all right now to 5 being I feel I have recovered well now.

Question 1/12

I’m generally OK most of the time

Question 2/12

I don’t understand why I got into an abusive relationship

Question 3/12

Question 10/12

Question 11/12

question.title:
Good job
It's difficult stuff so a relaxation session is coming up next.

In the meantime how are you feeling?
question.text: There is a break coming up soon, but if you could do with a break now, please take off the headset and seek support

answers.text: I could do with a break

question.title: Ask Doctor Clifford
question.text: Dr Clifford is a Trauma Specialist, we have asked her to answer the four questions below- please click on any question that you want to and you will see a video answer

answers.text: Does coercive control have an effect on children?
Find out more about “walking on eggshells”
Why is Coercive Control sometimes hard to recognise?

question.text: Please take off your headset for a short break and complete the paper exercise that will be given to you.
On the next screen click and drag on the stones representing the values you want to bring with you into this next phase of your life. You can select up to six

question.title: These are some prompts to help you remember and activate these values
question.text: These are some prompts to help you remember and activate these values, please highlight the ones that are useful to you

answers.text: I can diary or journal about my three top values
I can put them on stickies around my house
I can tell a friend and ask them to remind me about them
I can think of one thing I can do everyday to put a value into practice

question.title: Now the module is over, how are you feeling?
question.text: The module will be finishing in about four minutes but if you need to take a break, please remove the headset and ask for support if needed.

question.title: Congratulations
question.text:
You have completed module one
Please remove your headset and ask your facilitator for further instruction

playlist.title:
If you recognise any of these,
flip the card to see what you can do..

question.text: I spend a lot of time going over what happened and wishing I could change it

answers.text:
Ask your GP about CBT Cognitive behavioural therapy

This helps and you can access it online too

question.text: I can’t talk to my friends or family but I don’t want to see a therapist

answers.text: Online forums and support groups are a great way of finding support

question.text: I need to see people face to face who might have experienced what I have

answers.text: A good therapist might help, but there are many organisations and charities out there who can help you move forward

question.text: I am getting physical symptoms, panics, shaking, sleeplessness, dry mouth

answers.text:
There are therapies and medications that can help

Your GP is the best person to advise

playlist.title:
If you recognise any of these,
flip the card to see what you can do..

question.text: I am just finding it hard to move on from the relationship, even though I am glad I am out of it.

answers.text:
Maybe try a new hobby, course, or walk in nature every-day

Healthy distractions on a bad day do help

question.text: I feel so wound up all the time

answers.text: Have you thought of Mindfulness, Meditation, Yoga, Tai Chi or Prayer? These are ways of reconnecting

question.text: I just cry out of the blue, I have no energy and can’t feel motivated to do anything.

answers.text: Feeling sadness and grieving is a natural part of healing, give yourself time and you can always talk to a professional

question.text: If you need support, having that first conversation is the most difficult bit, pick three of the following people who you could think of approaching.

answers.text: A Priest, Rabbi, Iman, Guru or other
A friend on Facebook or social media site.

question.title: How are you doing?
question.text: There is a break coming up soon, but if you could do with a break now, please take off the headset and seek support.

answers.text: I could do with a break

question.title: Ask Doctor Clifford
question.text: We have asked Dr Clifford, an expert on coercive control, a series of 5 questions. Please click on any of them to see her answer

answers.text: Is there a pattern to Coercive control?
Is psychological violence as bad as physical violence?
Why can abusers seem to overstep our boundaries at times?
How does coercive control affect us?

question.text: Please take off your headset for a short break and complete the paper exercise that will be given to you.

question.title: Instructions
question.text: On the next screen, click and drag the bricks to fill in the empty spaces and build your own yellow brick road
These are some prompts to help you remember and activate these ideas, please highlight the ones that are useful to you

answers.text: I will find out info about three new hobbies this week
I can try out three “feel- good activities” this week, ie walking, coffee with a friend or listening to my favourite music
I can ask a friend to do one of these activities with me this week
I can challenge myself to do something new and out of my comfort zone this week!

question.text: Now the module is nearly over, how are you feeling?

question.title: Congratulations
question.text:
You have completed module two
Please remove your headset and ask your facilitator for further instructions
I can’t believe I ever got into that relationship- I was so naïve

answers.text: I was genuine, he/she was not, abusers are clever at hooking people

question.text: Nothing I do ever turns out well

answers.text: I have had challenges but there are lots of things I am proud of in my life

question.text: All men are abusive, there are no good ones out there

answers.text: I have been unlucky, I know there are good men out there.

question.text: I don’t feel I can ever be in a relationship again

answers.text: I may not be ready yet, when healed, I could have a new relationship

question.text: Nobody really cares about me

answers.text: I know there are plenty of people who care about me, I just need to reach out to them.

question.text: Bad things always seem to happen to me

answers.text: I know plenty of people who are about me, I could reach out to them

question.text: I don’t deserve to be happy

answers.text: There is no actual reason why I should not be happy

question.text: I don’t like anything about myself

answers.text: There are aspects of myself that I do like.

question.text: My life is always a mess

answers.text: I have had good times in my life and want more of them

question.text: Other people’s lives are so much better than mine

answers.text: Other people have their problems too. Don’t believe everything you see on social media!

question.text: There is no use trying anything new- it won’t work

answers.text: I won’t know until I have tried!

question.text: I have so much baggage

answers.text: Everyone has baggage- it’s called life!

question.title: How are you feeling?
question.text: There is a break coming up soon, but if you could do with a break now, please take off the headset and seek support.

answers.text: I could do with a break

question.title: Ask Doctor Clifford
question.text: We have asked Dr Clifford, an expert on coercive control, a series of four questions. Please click on any of them:

answers.text: What effect does domestic abuse have on adult family members and friends?
Why recognising abusive behaviours can make perpetrators feel threatened

question.text: Please take off your headset for a short break and complete the paper exercise that will be given to you

question.title: Pick your top 3
question.text: How are you going to grow your key strengths this week? Please highlight the ones that are useful to you

answers.text: Bring one of them to a situation in your life this week
Read  about or listen to someone that has these strengths
Ask a friend or family member, to remind you of your strengths
Write a list of your strengths on your phone and look at them a few times a day
When you wake up make a commitment to trying to be this person each day
At bedtime think of the strengths you showed today

question.title: Now the module is over, how are you feeling?
question.text: Now the module is over, how are you feeling?

question.text:

answers.text: What can be the trigger for leaving?
Anxiety and Post Traumatic stress disorder
What is Complex Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (CPSD)?

question.text: Please take off your headset for a short break and complete the paper exercise that will be given to you
On the next screen you will now see a gift box and a bin, please move as much into each as you like

question.title: From your gift box and shredder, chose 3 from each.
question.text: How are we going to make sure we stick to these commitments? Please highlight the ones that are useful to you

answers.text: Write them down and stick them on your bedroom mirror
Make up mantras and say them before you get out of bed each morning
Practice self-agency and know you have the power to have those difficult conversations
Plan, set intentions and do them!
Practice gratitude for what you have that’s good
